bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 136 (Friday, July 31, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. DEUTCH:H.R. 7907.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Clause 1 of Section 8 of Article I of the U.S. Constitutionand Clause 18 of Section 8 of Article I of the U.S.Constitution.[Page H4214]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary, and in addition to the Committees on House Administration, and the Budget, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

item.title: National Criminal Justice Commission Act of 2019

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

item.title: A bill to improve and reform policing practices, accountability, and transparency.

latestAction.text: Motion to proceed to consideration of measure made in Senate. (CR S7995)

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

summary.text:
National Criminal Justice Commission Act of 2020

This bill establishes the National Criminal Justice Commission. The commission must conduct a comprehensive review of the criminal justice system; make recommendations for criminal justice reform; and disseminate findings and guidance to the federal government and to state, local, and tribal governments.

bill.title: National Criminal Justice Commission Act of 2020

item.title: National Criminal Justice Commission Act of 2020
National Criminal Justice Commission Act of 2020
To establish the National Criminal Justice Commission.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
